etymology.description: 冒(冒) (mào, "risk") as phonetic -> 冃(冃) (mào, "hat") as original form -> later added 目(目) (mù, "eye") for semantic connection to look/appearance + 巾(巾) (jīn, "cloth") = cloth covering
etymology.interpretation: The character 帽(mào, "hat") combines 巾(巾) (jīn, "cloth") for its fabric aspect with the phonetic 冒(冒) (mào, "risk") to convey a sound. The original form 冃(冃) was adapted to include 目(目) (mù, "eye") and 巾(巾) (jīn, "cloth") to emphasize its use as a wearable item that covers the head.

examples.chinese: 夏天时(夏天時)，我总喜欢戴帽(我總喜歡戴帽)。
examples.pinyin: Xiàtiān shí, wǒ zǒng xǐhuān dài mào.
examples.english: During summer, I always like to wear a hat.

examples.chinese: 他用布做了新帽(他用布做了新帽)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yòng bù zuòle xīn mào.
examples.english: He made a new hat out of cloth.

examples.chinese: 下雨天时(下雨天時)，我忘记带帽(我忘記帶帽)。
examples.pinyin: Xiàyǔ tiān shí, wǒ wàngjì dài mào.
examples.english: On rainy days, I forget to bring my hat.
